page.title: 10Arable Farming/Guyzance Area
page.content: The fertile soils of the area enable extensive cultivation of arable crops. The main crop grown is barley.Although spring barley is still sown,farmers are increasingly changing to autumn drilled seed.The seed germinates before winter and in early spring it is top dressed with nitrogen based fertiliser to encourage rapid growth. The barley can be harveted in mid- summer.Much of the crop is crushed for animal feed but surplus grain is sold through a local farmers'co-operative. The most common root crops are potatoes and turnips(swede).The latter are used for winter fodder for cattle and sheep.Recently farmers have been encouraged by subsidies to grow oil seed rape and brilliant yellow fields have become a feature.The land is fertilised with farmyard manure and Nitram chemical fertiliser.
